issues.description: The problem statement (UML) and the solution expect Stock to provide a method named addToStockIngredients(StockIngredient), but the template Stock class provides a method named addItem(StockIngredient) instead. This name/signature mismatch is structural: students following the UML or the problem wording will look for addToStockIngredients but the provided starter code does not contain it, which can cause confusion or compile errors when they attempt to integrate their SealSaloon implementation with the template code.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the method name consistent across artifacts. Either (A) change the template Stock class to provide addToStockIngredients(StockIngredient) (and keep addItem as an alias if desired), or (B) update the problem statement/UML to refer to addItem(StockIngredient) instead of addToStockIngredients. Prefer adding addToStockIngredients to the template (delegating to the existing addItem implementation) so students can follow the UML and the solution code without compilation issues.

issues.description: The Stock API for adding a StockIngredient is named inconsistently across artifacts. The problem statement (class diagram) declares addToStockIngredients(StockIngredient) and the solution implements addToStockIngredients(...), but the template's Stock class exposes the method addItem(StockIngredient) instead. This creates a mapping barrier: students reading the problem diagram expect addToStockIngredients, the template code (what they start from) only provides addItem, and the solution uses addToStockIngredients when demonstrating acceptSupplyDelivery. Students may be confused which method to call when implementing SealSaloon.acceptSupplyDelivery, or encounter compile errors if they follow one artifact while referencing another.
issues.suggested_fix: Unify the method name across all artifacts. Rename the template's Stock.addItem(StockIngredient) to addToStockIngredients(StockIngredient) (and update any internal references) so it matches the problem diagram and the solution. Alternatively, if changing the solution is preferred, update the problem statement and solution to use addItem consistently. The first option (renaming template -> addToStockIngredients) minimizes student confusion and aligns the starter code with the specified API in the problem description.
